text.0: sit down o friends and sing aloud to him who purifies himself.
text.1: deck him for glory like a child with holy rites.
text.2: unite him bringing household wealth even as a calf with mother kine.
text.3: him who hath double strength the god delighting juice.
text.4: purify him who gives us power that he most blessed one may be.
text.5: a banquet for the troop mitra and varuṇa.
text.6: voices have sung aloud to thee as finderout of wealth for us.
text.7: we clothe the hue thou wearest with a robe of milk.
text.8: thou indu art the food of gods o sovran of all gladdening drinks.
text.9: as friend for friend be thou best finder of success.
text.10: drive utterly away from us each demon each voracious fiend.
text.11: the godless and the false keep sorrow far away.
